column4: Do you know what that package is? Do you want that package installed?
no matter if i try to install something that allready installed or if i just try to install lets say VLC it tries to remove that package
and i cannont continue without uninstalling it
That's aptitude, apt-get doesn't actually remove that type of package automatically.
That will work, but are you sure you really need that package?
yes my Teamspeak 3 server wont connect to my mysql server without it
Ok, then you should explicitly apt-get install it so that apt / aptitude know that you want it installed.
so aptitude is more of a auto thing for less involved users?
if your cpu is below 60C while under load you are ok

Yes, aptitude also has a pseudo GUI (ncurses) interface option and other features. Debian's official policy is to recommend aptitude, Ubuntu's general policy is to use apt-get, and in all honesty in most cases either will work just fine.
